instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> bad? Still boots using external monitor.
threads.message: I am looking at a Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and after close inspection it looks to me like the <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> has a few balls fused together. The Macbook still booted up using an external monitor. Can the <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> be bad while still being able to boot using an external monitor? Or is the chip actually good because it would not display to a monitor without this chip working?

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> bad? Still boots using external monitor.
threads.message: If you can see crap under the <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> it is bad, replace it. This chip does not affect external of course.

threads.title: Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> bad? Still boots using external monitor.
